page.title: 09DYSENTRY IN MOUNTAIN ASH
page.content: During the Spring of 1985 pupils in several schools,including Pengeulan Primary,suffered mysterious outbreaks of sickness and diarrhoea.The mystery illness was diagnosed as a mild form of {dysentry.}As a result all the schools affected were closed and all pupils, whether infected or not,were told to stay at home and not return until the disease had subsided.{Our {school was closed for three weeks} and everything was washed with disinfectant.It was widely reported in the Welsh daily newspapers and on BBC and HTV Wales news programmes. Water supplies and school canteens were tested for traces of the bacteria, but no reason for the outbreak could be found.Fortunately however,the disease disappeared just as quickly and as mysteriously as it had arrived.
